ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Phenotype/diagnosis for the subject
Description of the phenotype for the subject
Phone Survey Type
What time did you go to bed last night? (exact)
What time did you go to bed last night? (range)
How long did it take to fall asleep?
Notes: 0=0-30 minutes; 1=30-60 minutes; 2=1-2 hours; 3=2-4 hours; 4=Greater than 4 hours

ElementDescription: How many times did you wake up during the night?
How many hours of sleep did you get?
Notes: 0=0-3 hours; 1=4-5 hours; 2=6-7 hours; 3=8-10 hours; 4=More than 10 hours

ElementDescription: Parent: How would you rate your child's sleep quality last night?     Child/Self: How would you rate your sleep quality last night?
Notes: 1= Very good ; 2= Fairly good ; 3= Fairly bad ; 4= Very bad ; -99= N/A ; 77= Refused ; 88= Missing

ElementDescription: Did you take any medication specifically to help you sleep last night?
Where are you right now?
Notes: 1=At home; 2=At the home of family; 3=At the home of friends; 4=At work; 5=In class education; 6=In a public business; 7=In a vehicle; 8=In a hospital; 9=Inside other; 10=Outside other; 11= Boyfriend's/Girlfriend's/Partner's place; 12= Party; 13=Bar/Club; 14=Restaurant; 15=Walking somewhere; 16=Major entertainment event (sports, tailgate, concert)

ElementDescription: Who is with you at this moment?
Notes: 1=Alone; 2=Spouse or partner; 3=Other family members; 4=Friends; 5=Coworkers; 6=With supervisor; 7=With unknown people; 8=With pets

ElementDescription: What are you doing?
Notes: 0=Nothing; 1=Eating or drinking; 2=Personal care; 3=Taking medication; 4=Working; 5=Household chores; 6=Shopping; 7=Physical leisure; 8=Social interactions; 9=Traveling; 10=Internet browsing; 11=Non-physical leisure; 12=Other

ElementDescription: How productive are you being in what you are doing?
How confident are you in what you're doing?
How relaxed are you?
How happy are you?
How energetic are you?
How sad or depressed are you?
How angry or upset are you?
How anxious or nervous are you?
How stressed are you?
How impulsive do you feel?
How masculine do you feel?
How feminine do you feel?
What is your current mood?
Notes: -4=Most depressed ever; -3=Severely depressed; -2=Moderately depressed; -1=Mildly depressed; 0=Even or euthymic; 1=Mildly manic; 2=Moderately manic; 3=Severely manic; 4=Most manic ever

ElementDescription: Do you want to call San Diego crisis line?
In the past 24 hours, my thinking has been slow
In the past 24 hours, it has been hard to switch my attention between different activities
In the past 24 hours, I have had trouble concentrating
In the past 24 hours, I have had trouble remembering things
Since the last questionnaire, have you taken or used any of the following?
Did you take medications for bipolar today?
Notes: 0=Did not take meds; 1=Yes, took some meds; 2=Yes, took all meds

ElementDescription: People experience stress due to many different types of situations. When you think back on your day, what kind of situation caused you the most stress?
Specify other event or type of event (e.g., Financial, Health) that caused the most stress in the past 24 hours
How stressful was the past 24 hours' most stressful event at its peak?
What did you do today to cope with this stress?
Notes: 1=Tried to block it out; 2=Tried to calm down; 3=Tried to fix the problem; 4=Thought differently; 5=Talked to someone; 6=Other

ElementDescription: Specify other method to cope with the past 24 hours' greatest stress
Did you engage in any physical activity or exercise for at least 20 mins in the last 24 hrs?
Please choose the intensity of this activity (sustained for at least 20 minutes within the last 24 hours)
On how many occasions did you eat today?
Site
MetaTrial Visit ID
Notes: System variable: unique code for each type of visit -use to merge files

ElementDescription: Visit name
Numeric Visit Number
Notes: -1.5 = Pre-Screening; -1 = Screening; 0 = Baseline; ## = Visit ## (from 1 to 10); Whole numbers = standard monthly visits; #.001 - #.009 = Unscheduled; #.1 = End of Phase 1; #.2 = End of Phase 2; #.3 = End of Phase 3; #.4 = End of Open Choice Phase; #.5 = End of Study; #.6 = Genetic Analysis; 1000=all visits
